summary: This is an email chain from August 12, 2019, discussing and editing a timeline of Jeffrey Epstein's arrival and initial housing at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in July 2019. It details his movement from general population to the Special Housing Unit (SHU) and Psychology Observation, clarifying that his placement in Psychology Observation was for evaluation, not suicide watch.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the email chain; the timeline details his arrival and housing at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in July 2019.

events.title: Epstein arrives at MCC
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein arrived at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) on a Saturday and was initially placed in the Receiving and Discharge area before being moved to general population.

events.title: Moved to Special Housing Unit (SHU)
events.description: The Warden identified Epstein as a high-profile inmate and moved him from general population to the Special Housing Unit (SHU) due to concerns for his personal safety.

events.title: Placed in Psychology Observation
events.description: Upon return from court, Epstein was moved to Psychology Observation for evaluation by Psychology Service Staff. The email clarifies this was NOT suicide watch, but 24-hour observation to assess his readiness to return to SHU.

events.title: Returned to SHU with cellmate
events.description: Epstein was returned to the Special Housing Unit (SHU) with a cellmate, where he remained until July 23.

locations: NYM (likely refers to New York Metropolitan Correctional Center)
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein arrived at the MCC on July 6, 2019, and was initially placed in general population because staff were unaware he was a high-profile inmate.
The Warden moved him to the Special Housing Unit (SHU) on July 7, 2019, due to safety concerns.
On July 8, 2019, Epstein was placed in Psychology Observation for evaluation, which the email explicitly states was NOT suicide watch.
Epstein was returned to the SHU with a cellmate on July 10, 2019, and remained there until at least July 23, 2019.
The email is an internal review and edit of this timeline, intended for accuracy before being sent to a recipient identified as 'M.'.
